column2: The EU offshore Renewable Energy Strategy. Assessment: In 2023, the cumulative installed capacity for wind offshore was on the order of 19 GW
column5: The increase in offshore wind capacity is likely to contribute to the growth of renewable energy in the transport sector, which is a key aspect of the target to achieve a 29% share of renewable energy in the final consumption of energy in the transport sector by 2030.

column2: The EU offshore Renewable Energy Strategy. Assessment: In 2023, the cumulative installed capacity for wind offshore was on the order of 19 GW
column5: The expansion of offshore wind energy is expected to support the achievement of the target to achieve 18% of the total increase in the share of energy from renewable sources between 2020 and 2030.

column2: The strategy sets targets for an installed capacity of at least 1 GW of ocean energy by 2030 and 40 GW by 2050
column5: The development of ocean energy may face challenges in competing with other forms of renewable energy, such as offshore wind, which could hinder the achievement of the target to achieve a 29% share of renewable energy in the final consumption of energy in the transport sector by 2030.

column2: Around 30% of EU primary steel production is expected to be decarbonised on the basis of renewable hydrogen
column5: The use of renewable hydrogen in the steel industry is likely to support the achievement of the target to reach a minimum recycled content percentage for each battery model per year and per manufacturing plant.

column2: Halve the amount of residual (non-recycled) municipal waste by 2030
column5: The reduction of municipal waste is likely to increase the availability of materials for recycling, which could support the achievement of the target to produce at least 25% of the Union's annual consumption of strategic raw materials through recycling.

column2: Double EU’s circular material use rate in the coming decade
column5: The increase in circular material use rate is likely to support the achievement of the target to reach a benchmark of at least 40% of the Union's annual deployment needs for strategic net-zero technologies.

column2: By 2030, Union extraction capacity should be able to extract the ores, minerals or concentrates needed to produce at least 10% of the Union’s annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column5: The development of extraction capacity may face challenges in competing with other countries, which could hinder the achievement of the target to diversify the Union's imports of strategic raw materials.

column2: By 2030, Union processing capacity, including for all intermediate processing steps, should be able to produce at least 40% of the Union’s annual consumption of strategic raw materials
column5: The increase in processing capacity is likely to support the achievement of the target to reach a benchmark of at least 40% of the Union's annual deployment needs for strategic net-zero technologies.

column2: Producers of starting, lighting and ignition batteries, industrial batteries and electric vehicle batteries or, where appointed in accordance with Article 57(1), producer responsibility organisations, shall take back, free of charge and without an obligation on the end-user to buy a new battery
column5: The take-back requirement for batteries is likely to support the achievement of the target to reach a minimum recycled content percentage for each battery model per year and per manufacturing plant.

column2: Producers of portable batteries or, where appointed in accordance with Article 57(1), producer responsibility organisations, shall attain, and maintain durably, at least the following collection targets for waste portable batteries
column5: The collection targets for portable batteries are likely to support the achievement of the target to reach a minimum recycled content percentage for each battery model per year and per manufacturing plant.

column2: Producers of LMT batteries or, where appointed in accordance with Article 57(1), producer responsibility organisations, shall attain, and maintain durably, at least the following collection targets of waste LMT batteries
column5: The collection targets for LMT batteries are likely to support the achievement of the target to reach a minimum recycled content percentage for each battery model per year and per manufacturing plant.

column2: Any natural or legal person that places on the market products incorporating portable batteries shall ensure that those batteries are readily removable and replaceable by the end-user at any time during the lifetime of the product
column5: The requirement for removable and replaceable batteries is likely to support the achievement of the target to reach a minimum recycled content percentage for each battery model per year and per manufacturing plant.

column2: Recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recycling efficiency
column5: The targets for recycling efficiency are likely to support the achievement of the target to reach a minimum recycled content percentage for each battery model per year and per manufacturing plant.

column2: Recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recycling efficiency
column5: The targets for recycling efficiency are likely to support the achievement of the target to reach a minimum recycled content percentage for each battery model per year and per manufacturing plant.

column2: All recycling shall achieve at least the following targets for recovery of materials
column5: The targets for recovery of materials are likely to support the achievement of the target to reach a minimum recycled content percentage for each battery model per year and per manufacturing plant.

column2: By 31 December 2025, each Member State shall agree to establish a framework for cooperation on joint projects with one or more other Member States for the production of renewable energy
column5: The cooperation on joint projects for renewable energy production is likely to support the achievement of the target to increase the cumulative installed capacity for wind offshore.

column2: The amount of renewable fuels and renewable electricity supplied to the transport sector leads to a: (i) share of renewable energy within the final consumption of energy in the transport sector of at least 29 % by 2030
column5: The development of renewable fuels and electricity for the transport sector may face challenges in competing with other forms of renewable energy, such as renewable hydrogen for steel production, which could hinder the achievement of the target to decarbonise the steel industry.

column2: Each Member State shall increase the share of renewable energy in the heating and cooling sector by at least 0.8 percentage points as an annual average calculated for the period 2021 to 2025 and by at least 1.1 percentage points as an annual average calculated for the period 2026 to 2030
column5: The increase in renewable energy in the heating and cooling sector is likely to support the achievement of the target to increase the installed capacity of ocean energy.

column2: By 2022, achieve 18% of the total increase in the share of energy from renewable sources between that Member State’s binding 2020 national target, and its contribution to the 2030 target of the share of energy from renewable sources in gross final consumption of energy
column5: The achievement of the 18% target is likely to support the achievement of the target to increase the cumulative installed capacity for wind offshore.

column2: Member States shall ensure that the total final energy consumption of all public bodies combined is reduced by at least 1.9% each year, when compared to 2021
column5: The reduction in energy consumption of public bodies is likely to support the achievement of the target to reduce the energy consumption of the EU by at least 11.7% in 2030 compared to the projections of the 2020 EU Reference Scenario.

column2: Member States shall collectively ensure a reduction of energy consumption of at least 11.7% in 2030 compared to the projections of the 2020 EU Reference Scenario
column5: The reduction in energy consumption is likely to support the achievement of the target to reduce the energy consumption of public bodies.

column2: Member States shall make efforts to collectively contribute to the indicative Union primary energy consumption target amounting to no more than 992.5 Mtoe in 2030
column5: The reduction in primary energy consumption is likely to support the achievement of the target to reduce the energy consumption of the EU.

column2: Each Member State shall ensure that at least 3% of the total floor area of heated and/or cooled buildings that are owned by public bodies is renovated each year to be transformed into at least nearly zero-energy buildings or zero-emission buildings
column5: The renovation of public buildings is likely to support the achievement of the target to reduce buildings’ final energy consumption by 14%.

column2: Reduce buildings’ final energy consumption by 14%
column5: The reduction in buildings’ final energy consumption is likely to support the achievement of the target to renovate public buildings.

column2: At least double the annual energy renovation rate of residential and non-residential buildings by 2030 and to foster deep energy renovations
column5: The increase in energy renovation rate is likely to support the achievement of the target to reduce buildings’ final energy consumption.

column2: Reduce buildings’ energy consumption for heating and cooling by 18% compared to 2015 levels by 2030
column5: The reduction in energy consumption for heating and cooling is likely to support the achievement of the target to reduce buildings’ final energy consumption.

column2: Member states will have to renovate 16% of worst-performing non-residential buildings by 2030 and, by 2033, the worst-performing 26% through minimum energy performance requirements
column5: The renovation of non-residential buildings is likely to support the achievement of the target to reduce buildings’ final energy consumption.

column2: The national measures will have to ensure that at least 55% of the decrease of the average primary energy use is achieved through the renovation of the worst-performing buildings
column5: The renovation of worst-performing buildings is likely to support the achievement of the target to reduce buildings’ final energy consumption.

column2: Member States shall ensure that the average primary energy use of the entire residential building stock decreases by at least 16% compared to 2020 by 2030
column5: The reduction in primary energy use is likely to support the achievement of the target to reduce buildings’ final energy consumption.

column2: By 2030, the share of renewable energy in the electricity mix should double to 55-60%, and projections show a share of around 84% by 2050
column5: The increase in renewable energy in the electricity mix is likely to support the achievement of the target to increase the cumulative installed capacity for wind offshore.

column2: Member States are required to achieve cumulative end-use energy savings from 2021 to 2030, equivalent to new annual savings of at least 0.8% of final energy consumption in 2021-2023, at least 1.3% in 2024-2025, 1.5% in 2026-2027 and 1.9% in 2028-2030
column5: The achievement of energy savings is likely to support the achievement of the target to reduce the energy consumption of the EU.
